What to Know About the University of Pretoria Application Form Portal

The University of Pretoria UP Application portal is designed to accept applications of candidates seeking admission into the University. In the portal, applicants can Purchase application forms, Track and monitor application status, pay fees, Print Acknowledgement Slips, check the admission list, etc.

University of Pretoria

The University of Pretoria (UP) is a public research university in Pretoria, South Africa. It was founded in 1908 and is one of the largest universities in South Africa, with over 50,000 students and 3,000 academic staff.

UP offers various undergraduate and postgraduate programs in agriculture, engineering, natural sciences, humanities, law, health sciences, and social sciences. The university is also well-known for its research activities, particularly in sustainable development, biodiversity conservation, and health sciences.

Key Facts About the University of Pretoria:

Rankings:

UP is consistently ranked as one of the top universities in South Africa and Africa. It is currently ranked 601-650 in the world by the QS World University Rankings 2025.

Campus:

UP’s main campus is located in Hatfield, Pretoria. The university also has other campuses in Groenkloof, Prinshof, and Mamelodi.

Language policy:

UP is a bilingual university that provides instruction in English and Afrikaans. However, the university is committed to promoting multilingualism and encourages students to learn other languages.

Student life:

UP has a vibrant student life, with over 100 student organizations and clubs, including sports teams, cultural groups, and academic societies. The university also has a range of facilities, including libraries, sports facilities, and student housing.

Admission Requirements:

The admission requirements for UP vary depending on the program and level of study. Generally, applicants need to have a minimum level of academic achievement and meet the language requirements. International students may also need to submit proof of English language proficiency.

Financial Aid:

UP offers various forms of financial aid, such as scholarships, bursaries, and loans, to help students fund their education. The university also has a financial aid office to assist students with their financial needs.

If you’re interested in studying at UP, you can visit the university’s website for more information on the programs, admission requirements, and application process.

Who is Eligible to Apply for Admission

To be eligible for admission to the UP application portal, candidates must;

  • Have a Secondary School Leaving Certificate
  • Meet National Senior Certificate (NSC) requirement for admission into Higher Certificate
  • Grade 12 certificate applicant is an added advantage
  • Must write the NBTs for admission to UP on/before 15 October 2025.
  • FPS of 480 or above.
  • NBT scores of Upper
  • Intermediate for AL & QL
  • Mathematics 60%
  • English HL 50%
  • English FAL 60%

University of Pretoria Application Requirements | UP Application Form 2025

The admission requirements for the University of Pretoria (UP) vary depending on the program and level of study. Here are some general requirements for undergraduate and postgraduate applicants:

Undergraduate:

  1. National Senior Certificate (NSC) or equivalent with bachelor’s degree studies admission, as certified by the South African Matriculation Board (or equivalent for international applicants).
  2. A minimum score of 4 (50-59%) for English as a language of learning and teaching in Grade 12 or equivalent.
  3. Depending on the program, a minimum score of 4 (50-59%) for Mathematics, Mathematical Literacy or Technical Mathematics in Grade 12 or equivalent.
  4. Meeting the specific admission requirements of the program applied for.

Postgraduate:

  1. An appropriate bachelor’s degree or equivalent qualification.
  2. Meeting the minimum academic requirements for the program applied for.
  3. Submission of official academic transcripts and degree certificates.
  4. Meeting the specific admission requirements of the program applied for.

Additional requirements may include submitting a personal statement, CV, and letters of recommendation.

It’s important to note that some programs may have additional requirements, such as a portfolio or audition for programs in the arts or a certain level of proficiency in a particular language for language programs.

International applicants may also need to submit proof of English language proficiency, such as a TOEFL or IELTS score.

Applicants should consult the UP website or contact the university’s admissions office for detailed information on the admission requirements for their chosen program.

University of Pretoria Application Fees

The University of Pretoria (UP) application fee varies depending on the program and level of study. Here are the current application fees for 2025:

Undergraduate:

  • South African citizens: R300
  • International applicants from the Southern African Development Community (SADC) region: R300
  • International applicants from outside the SADC region: R500

Postgraduate:

  • South African citizens: R500
  • International applicants from the SADC region: R500
  • International applicants from outside the SADC region: R700

It’s important to note that the application fee is non-refundable and must be paid before the application can be processed. The fee can be paid online or deposited into the university’s bank account. The payment details are provided on the online application portal.

University of Pretoria – Steps to Apply

Here are the steps to apply to the University of Pretoria:

Choose your program:

Visit the University of Pretoria website to explore the programs offered by the university and choose the program you would like to apply for.

Meet the admission requirements:

Review the admission requirements for the program to ensure that you meet the minimum requirements for admission.

Submit your application:

Complete the online application form on the UP website. Ensure to provide accurate and complete information and attach all required documents, such as academic transcripts and identification documents.

Pay the application fee:

Pay the application fee online or deposit it into the university’s bank account. Remember to attach proof of payment to your application.

Track your application status:

After submitting your application, you can track its status online. You will also receive email notifications regarding the status of your application.

Respond to any requests for additional information:

The university may contact you if they require additional information or documents to process your application. Make sure to respond promptly to any requests.

Receive your admission decision:

The university will notify you of their admission decision via email or post. If accepted, you will receive an admission letter with information on how to accept the offer and enrol in the program.

University of Pretoria Application Required Documents

To apply to UP, you need to submit the following documentation:

  • A completed application form
  • A copy of your results for the latest school year
  • A copy of your ID
  • If you have attended another higher education institution, we need a copy of your academic transcript

For more information regarding the application for admission into the University of Pretoria, kindly drop your messages in the comment box below.

The University of Pretoria Application Fee Waiver

The University of Pretoria (UP) offers application fee waivers for applicants who cannot pay the application fee due to financial difficulties. The fee waiver is intended for South African citizens or permanent residents of South Africa with a combined household income of less than R350,000 per annum.

The applicant must complete and submit their online application form to apply for an application fee waiver. Once the application has been submitted, the applicant can complete and submit the Application Fee Waiver Form, available on the UP website.

The Application Fee Waiver Form requires the applicant to provide detailed information on their financial situation, including their income, expenses, and other sources of financial support. The form must be accompanied by supporting documents, such as bank statements and proof of income.

The UP financial aid office will review the fee waiver application, which will determine whether the applicant is eligible for the fee waiver based on their financial situation. If the fee waiver is granted, the applicant will be notified, and their application fee will be waived.

FAQ About the University of Pretoria Online Application

Sure, here are some frequently asked questions about the University of Pretoria application process:
How do I apply to the University of Pretoria?

Ans: You can apply to the University of Pretoria by completing the online application form on the university’s website.

What documents do I need to submit with my application?

Ans: The documents you need to submit with your application may vary depending on the program and level of study. Generally, you must submit academic transcripts, identification documents, and proof of payment for the application fee.

How much is the application fee for the University of Pretoria?

Ans: The application fee for the University of Pretoria varies depending on the program and level of study. You can check the current application fee on the university’s website.

How do I track the status of my application?

Ans: You can track the status of your application by logging in to the university’s online application portal.

When will I receive a decision on my application?

Ans: The time it takes to receive a decision on your application may vary depending on the program and level of study. You can check the estimated timeline for application processing on the university’s website.

How do I accept an offer of admission?

Ans: If accepted, you will receive an admission letter with information on how to accept the offer and enrol in the program.

Can I apply for financial aid?

Ans: The University of Pretoria offers financial aid to eligible students. You can visit the university’s financial aid office or website for more information on available options.

Can I request a fee waiver?

Ans: Yes, the University of Pretoria offers fee waivers for eligible applicants who cannot pay the application fee due to financial difficulties. You can visit the university’s website for more information on the fee waiver application process.
